title: I Know We Sometimes Joke About Our Chinese Overlord Tencent-Chan, But...
body:
Was checking out [Tencent's 2016Q1 Report](http://www.tencent.com/en-us/content/ir/news/2016/attachments/20160518.pdf) for fun when I found out about:

http://www.reuters.com/article/us-supercell-stake-tencent-holdings-idUSKCN0Z12BH

$6.6 Billion deal to acquire Supercell from SoftBank's current 51% stake in the Finnish game developer company. 

First impression: Tencent's growth rate is a beast - almost monopoly like in the low cost video gaming industry that focuses primarily on micro transactions, subscriptions, and sometimes advertisement/marketing.

Second thought: $15.841 billion in total revenue last year, $4.952 billion in this year's first fiscal quarter, even with a 51% stake in Supercell's $2.38 billion annual revenue of last year (probably gonna grow another 20% or so this year if left alone without any boosts), they're overpaying thinking probably thinking they're not because SoftBank "looks" like its weak and desperate. Maybe a boost of 5% growth in total revenue from this acquisition... Seems kind of dumb like ego stretching by flaunting their money as if they're swinging their big D around... Or maybe I'm wrong and that $6.6 billion purchase for about $1.25 billion annual revenue (somewhat conservative growth estimate even at ~20%) may end up paying multiples giving Tencent a stronger foothold into the current 35-40% share that mobile games have of the ~$100 billion gaming industry. Anybody who's ever researched into app development knows how competitive that market is.

I feel sorry for Riot because that $6.6 billion could have been reinvested into League of Legends. 

$6.6 billion and still no Dragon Master Swain.
